TF058320-EGYPT - AVIAN AND HUMAN
            INFLUENZA CONTROL AND PREVENTION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Avian
            and Human Influenza Control and Prevention Project is to
            minimize the threat posed to humans and poultry in Egypt by
            Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) infection and other
            zoonoses in domestic poultry and to prepare for, control and
            respond to an avian influenza pandemic and other infectious
            diseases emerging in humans. The changes will reallocate the
            savings from the cancelled $2.1 million procurement of Avian
            Influenza vaccines to provide laboratory equipments for a
            Biosafety Level 3 (BSL3) laboratory facility at the ministry
            of agriculture. Savings from cancelled procurement of
            vaccination equipment and from other completed contracts add
            up to additional savings of about $1.1 million. It is that
            the additional savings will be used to procure motorcycles
            and information technology equipment (laptop computers,
            internet connection, faxes) for the benefit of local
            veterinary clinics to enhance their capacity for disease
            management, surveillance, and reporting.
